page.title: 09MUTHILL EPISCOPAL CHURCH
page.content: { {St. James Episcopal Church} is close by the village school and Parish Kirk. It was built in 1836 following a long difficult period. After the 1745 rebellion, when the Episcopal Church was known to support the Stuarts, penal laws were passed forbidding baptisms by it.There is an entry in the register for 1750 recording the baptism of a child under cover of trees in the park of Lord Rollo of Duncrub to prevent discovery, as this put the minister in danger of imprisonment. The church was visited by {Queen Victoria} at a service in 1842. The present congregation is small and is served by a Rector who also has the charge of Crieff and Comrie.It is a small but beautiful church with some interesting memorial plaques referring to the above.
